div0.head: *r
div0.entryFree:
*r r, r(w=, to/, indecl., twentieth (later seventeenth) letter of the Gr. alphabet: as numeral r/ =
100 , but r'
=
100 , 000 : reckoned as a semivowel by Arist. Po. 1456b28 : the name r(w= occurs in Ar. Th. 781 , Callias ap. Ath. 10.453d , Pl. Cra. 426c , BCH 29.483 (Delos), etc.

r(a/ [a^], enclit. Particle, Ep. for a)/ra (q.v.), freq. in Hom.and Pi. ; less freq. in Trag. (lyr.),
h)= r(a
A. Pers. 633
, S. Aj. 172 ; h)/ r(a ib. 177 , B. 18.33 .—This and ka are the only monosyll. Particles not ending in e which allow elision.

r(a=, Adv.
easily, Alcm. 42 , S. Fr. 1086 , Ion Trag. 66 . [Codd. vary between r(a= and r(a/|; only r(a/| (r(a/i) seems to be admitted by A.D. Adv. 156.8 , Eust. 163.20 , but r(a= is prob. correct Attic and Dor. for *r(a_a^ whence Ep.
*r(h=a (written r(ei=a in Hom. but r(h/a in Alc. Supp. 12.7 ), later Ion.
r(e/a (q.v.); cf. Aeol.
bra=|.]

r(a=, to/,
rhubarb, Rheum officinale, Dsc. 3.2 ; growing near the river Rha (mod. Volga), whence its name acc. to Amm.Marc. 22.8.28 ; cf. r(h=on.
r(a/as: r(eu/mata, Hsch.

r(a^ba/ssw, Att.
pw/t-ttw,= r(a/ssw, a)ra/ssw,
make a noise, esp.
by dancing or
beating time with the feet, Hsch. , Phot. ; cf. a)rraba/ssw.

r(abbi/,
O my Master, Hebr. word in Ev.Matt. 23.7 , al.; also r(abboni/ or r(abbouni/, Ev.Marc. 10.51 , Ev.Jo. 20.16 .

r(abdeu/omai,
angle as with a rod, v. r(abdi/on
1.2 .
r(abdhfo/ros, on, poet. for r(abdofo/ros,= qursofo/ros, Lyc. 1140 .
r(a/bdida: ta\ didaskalei=a, Hsch.

r(abd-i/zw,
beat with a rod or
stick, cudgel, Ar. Lys. 587 , Pherecr. 50 , 2 Ep.Cor. 11.25 ( Pass. ); r(. de/ndra
thresh trees, to bring down the fruit, Thphr. CP 1.19.4 ( Pass. ), cf. PRyl. 148.20
(i A.D.); e)la/as
Thphr. CP 5.4.2
; r(. [kriqa/s]
thresh out barley, LXX Ru. 2.17 ; si=ton ib. Jd. 6.11 .

r(abd-i/on, to/, Dim. of
r(a/bdos,
little rod or
shoot, Thphr. HP 3.17.6 , Dsc. 1.14 ;
the wand of Hermes, Babr. 117.9 , Arr. Epict. 3.20.12 ; a)po\ r(abdi/ou oi)aki/zesqai, of horses, Str. 17.3.7 .
divining-rod, LXX Ez. 21.21 ( 26 )(cod. A).
barbel or
filament appended to the lips of certain fishes, which are said r(abdeu/esqai toi=s e)n tw=| sto/mati, a(\ kalou=sin oi( a(liei=s r(abdi/a
Arist. HA 620b32
.
iron stile, used in encaustic painting, Plu. 2.568a , Ath. 15.687b .
r(abdi/a a)konti/wn perh. javelin
shafts, BCH 35.16 (Delian inventory). teacher's
pointer (or = r(a/bdos
1.7 ), Eudem. ap. Simp. in Ph. 732.32 .
= a(/limon , Ps.- Dsc. 1.91 .

r(abd-ismo/s, o(,
winnowing, threshing,
PTeb. 119.46
(ii B.C.).

r(abd-isth/s, ou=, o(,
thresher, BGU 115i15
(ii A.D.), Sammelb. 5124.103
(ii A.D.), al.

r(abdo-di/aitos [i^], on ,
living by the painter's stile ( r(abdi/on
1.3
), epith. of Parrhasius, a parody on a(brodi/aitos, Ath. 12.543d , 15.687c .

r(abdo-eidh/s, e/s,
striped, po/a
Dsc. 3.97
; a)/nqos
Gp. 12.37
; go/mfoi
v.l. for labd- in Hippiatr. 96 .

r(abdo-mantei/a, h(,
divination by a wand,
Gloss.

r(abdo-ma^xi/a, h(,
fighting with a staff or
foil, Plu. Alex. 4 .

r(abdo-nome/w,
to be r(abdono/mos,
sit as umpire, S. Tr. 516 (lyr.).

r(abdo-no/mos, on, (ne/mw)
wielding a rod or
wand: hence of the Roman
lictors, Plu. Aem. 32 ;
umpire, Hsch.

r(abdo/-omai, Pass. ,
to be striped (cf. r(a/bdos
111
), Lyd. Mag. 1.7 .

r(a/bdos, h(,
rod, wand, Hom. (v. infr.), etc.; lighter than the bakthri/a or walking-stick, X. Eq. 11.4 (but = bakthri/a , Ev.Matt. 10.10 , al.). —Special uses:
magic wand, as that of Circe, Od. 10.238 , 319 , etc.; that with which Athena touched Odysseus, to restore his youthful appearance, xrusei/h| r(a/bdw| e)pema/ssato
16.172
; that with which Hermes overpowers the senses of man, Il. 24.343 ; that with which Hades rules the ghosts, Pi. O. 9.33 ;
divining-rod, Hdt. 4.67 .
fishing-rod, Od. 12.251 .
limed twig, for catching small birds, Ar. Av. 527 .
shaft of a hunting-spear, X. Cyn. 10.3 , 16 .
staff of office, like the earlier skh=ptron, Pl. Ax. 367a , LXX Ps. 44(45).7 , 109(110).2 ; carried by a brabeuth/s, Phld. Vit. p.25J. :— dub. in A. Supp. 248 for r(abdou=xos.
wand borne by the
r(ayw|do/s, to\n e)pi\ r(a/bdw| mu=qon u(faino/menon
Call. Fr. 138
( =
Fr. 3.10P. ), cf. Paus. 9.30.3 : hence kata\ r(a/bdon e)pe/wn according to the
measure of his (Homer's) verses, Pi. I. 4(3).38(56) .
rod for chastisement, r(. kosmou=sa
Pl. Lg. 700c
; ma/stic h)\ r(.
riding-switch, X. Eq. 8.4 ; r(. bohla/tis ox-
goad,
APl. 4.200 ( Mosch. ); cai/nesqai r(a/bdois
Plu. Alex. 51
, cf. AP 11.153 ( Lucill. ): of the
fasces of the Roman lictors, Plb. 11.29.6 , D.H. 4.11 , Str. 5.2.2 , Plu. Publ. 10 , Luc. 36 ; pro\s pe/nte r(a/bdous, = Lat.
at (i.e.
ad) quinque fasces (CIL
8.7044 (Numidia)), OGI 543.18 (Ancyra, ii A.D.), IGRom. 3.175 (ibid., ii A.D.); cf. r(abdono/mos, r(abdou=xos.
shepherd's staff or
crook, LXX Ps. 22(23).4 , Mi. 7.14 .
r(. klhronomi/as
measuring-rod, ib. Ps. 73(74).2 .
stitch, e)/ntosqen de\ boei/as r(a/ye qameia\s xrusei/h|s r(a/bdoisi dihneke/sin peri\ ku/klon
Il. 12.297
(unless it means
rivets, studs).
young shoot of some trees, Ion Trag. 40 , Thphr. HP 2.1.2 .
streak or
stripe on the skin of animals, diapoi/kila r(a/bdois
Arist. HA 525a12
; of fish, Clearch. 73 ; of clothes, Poll. 7.53 ;
fluting of a column, Supp.Epigr. 4.448.7 (Didyma, ii B.C., pl.); of minerals,
vein, Thphr. CP 4.12.6 , D.S. 5.37 ;
streak or
shaft of light, Arist. Mete. 377a30 , Mu. 395a31 , Thphr. Sign. 11 . in Gramm.,
line, verse, Sch. Pi. I. 4.63 .
a critical mark, like o)belo/s , Hsch.
stroke forming a letter, Theodect. 6.6 .

r(abdoux-e/w,
to be a r(abdou=xos,
carry a rod or
wand, esp. as a badge
of office, Hippias Erythr. ap. Ath. 6.259d ; of the Roman lictors,
bear the fasces, D.C. 48.43 :— Pass. ,
have the fasces borne before one, Plu. Num. 10 .

r(abdoux-i/a, h(,
office or
duties of a r(abdou=xos, BGU 244.14
(iii A.D.), POxy. 1626.21
(iv A.D.): at Rome,
the insignia of the lictor, fasces, Plu. Fab. 4 , Cic. 16 .

r(a/bdoux-os (properisp.), o(,
one who carries a rod or
staff of office:
judge, umpire at a contest, Pl. Prt. 338a .
magistrate's attendant, staff-bearer, beadle, Ar. Pax 734 , UPZ 3.6 (ii B.C., prob.), IG 9(2).735 (Larissa, iii B.C.), 1109.24 (Coropa, ii B.C.), Act.Ap. 16.35 ; so, prob., in Th. 5.50 : esp. at Rome, of the
lictors who carried the fasces, Plb. 5.26.10 , etc.: also r(abdou=xoi, ai( ,
female attendants on Oenanthe, mother of Agathocles, Id. 15.29.13 .

r(abdofor-e/w,
carry a wand or
stick, Str. 16.4.25 .

r(abdofor-i/a, h(,
office of r(abdofo/ros, IG 22.1368.131
(ii A.D.).

(iii B.C.).

carrying a rod or

lictor, Plb. 10.32.2 . Astrol., of
the planets (h(/lios being the basileu/s), Sch. A.R. 4.262 , cf. S.E. M. 5.31 .
